purejavahidapi
Interface HidDeviceInfo

public interface HidDeviceInfo

HidDeviceInfo instances represent all that be found out about a specific connected USB HID device without actually opening it. Basically the information that the lower level USB system learns from the device descriptor when the devise is plugged in.

For more details of see the USB Specification.

Method Summary

          This method returns the Manufacturer String if available otherwise null is returned.

Method Detail

getPath

java.lang.String getPath()
This method returns a string that represents a platform dependent path that describes the 'physical' path through hubs and ports to the device.

The main use of the path is to pass it to the PureJavaHidApi#openDevice(String) to obtain an instance {@link HidDevice} which can subsequently be used to communicate with the device.

Returns:
a string representing a 'path' to the device

getVendorId

short getVendorId()
This method returns the 16 bit Vendor Id of the device.

Note that the return type is short so when compared against literals or variables of type int sign extension interferes and thus it is necessary to cast the int type to short.

Returns:
the 16 bit Vendor Id

getProductId

short getProductId()
This method returns the 16 bit Product Id of the device.

Note that the return type is short so when compared against literals or variables of type int sign extension interferes and thus it is necessary to cast the int type to short.

Returns:
the 16 bit Product Id
